title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 150.3 - Definition and report of enrollment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 150.3 - Definition and report of enrollment

State Regulations

Nonpublic institutions of higher education eligible for

State aid pursuant to section
6402
of the

Education Law shall submit the following information: (a) A report of the number of full-time
students enrolled in each class year in approved programs in medicine and
dentistry, with the count of such students being further classified into lower
and upper divisions. A full-time student shall mean a student who is enrolled
for credits, hours or courses equal to at least 75 percent of the normal
full-time load for students prescribed by the institution. A lower-division
studentshall mean a student who has completed less than one half the curriculum
leading to the first professional degree. An upper-division student shall mean
a student who has completed one half or more of such curriculum. (b) A report in similar form and content
providing estimates of enrollment for the two academic years next succeeding
the report for the current year. (c) Such enrollment shall be that existing on
the 30th day after the beginning of the academic or class program year and
shall be reported within 15 days after such day on forms prescribed by the
commissioner. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
150.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
